openingRemarks: Solve these quadratic equations, i.e. equations of the form \(ax^2 + bx + c = 0\) where \(a \ne 0\)

questions.question: \(x^{2}-4 x=0\)
questions.answer:
\[
\begin{align*}
x^{2}-4 x&=0 \\ 
x(x-4)&=0 \\
x=0 && \text{or} \quad  x-4=0 \\
&& x=4 \\
\end{align*}
\]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+5 x+4=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 5 and c = 4

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 4) which add up to 5 ... and those factors are 4 and 1

Therefore replace 5x with 4x + 1x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+5 x+4&=0 \\ x^2 + 4x + 1x + 4&=0\\ (x^{2}+4 x)+(1x+4)&=0 \\ x(x+4)+1(x+4)&=0 \\ (x+1)(x+4)&=0 \\ x+1=0 && \text{or} \quad x+4=0 \\ x=-1 && x=-4\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+x-2=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 1 and c = -2

Looking for integer factors of (1 × -2) which add up to 1 ... and those factors are 2 and -1

Therefore replace x with 2x - 1x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+x-2&=0 \\ x^{2}+2 x-1 x-2&=0 \\ (x^{2}+2 x)-(1 x+2)&=0 \\ x(x+2)-1(x+2)&=0 \\ (x+2)(x-1)&=0 \\ x+2=0 && \text{or} \quad x-1=0 \\ x=-2 && x=1\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}-7 x+12=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = -7 and c = 12

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 12) which add up to -7 ... and those factors are -3 and -4

Therefore replace -7x with -3x - 4x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}-7 x+12&=0 \\ x^{2}-3x-4 x+12&=0 \\ (x^{2}-3x)-(4 x-12)&=0 \\ x(x-3) -4(x-3)&=0 \\ (x-3)(x-4)&=0 \\ x-3=0 && \text{or} \quad x-4=0 \\ x=3 && x=4\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+5 x+6=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 5 and c = 6

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 6) which add up to 5 ... and those factors are 3 and 2

Therefore replace 5x with 3x + 2x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+5 x+6&=0 \\ x^{2}+3 x+2 x+6&=0 \\ (x^{2}+3 x)+(2 x+6)&=0 \\ x(x+3)+2(x+3)&=0 \\ (x+3)(x+2)&=0 \\ x+3=0 && \text{or} \quad x+2=0 \\ x=-3 && x=-2\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}-7 x+10=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = -7 and c = 10

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 10) which add up to -7 ... and those factors are -5 and -2

Therefore replace -7x with -5x - 2x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}-7 x+10&=0 \\ x^{2}-5 x-2 x+10&=0 \\ (x^{2}-5 x)-(2 x-10)&=0 \\ x(x-5)-2(x-5)&=0 \\ (x-5)(x-2)&=0 \\ x-5=0 && \text{or} \quad x-2=0 \\ x=5 && x=2\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}-5 x+6=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = -5 and c = 6

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 6) which add up to -5 ... and those factors are -3 and -2

Therefore replace -5x with -3x - 2x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}-5 x+6&=0 \\ x^{2}-3 x-2 x+6&=0 \\ (x^{2}-3 x)-(2 x-6)&=0 \\ x(x-3)-2(x-3)&=0 \\ (x-2)(x-3)&=0 \\ x-2=0 && \text{or} \quad x-3=0 \\ x=2 && x=3\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+9 x+20=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 9 and c = 20

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 20) which add up to 9 ... and those factors are 5 and 4

Therefore replace 9x with 5x + 4x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+9 x+20&=0 \\ x^{2}+5 x+4 x+20&=0 \\ (x^{2}+5 x)+(4 x+20)&=0 \\ x(x+5)+4(x+5)&=0 \\ (x+4)(x+5)&=0 \\ x+4=0 && \text{or} \quad x+5=0 \\ x=-4 && x=-5\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}-8 x+15=0\)
questions.f:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = -8 and c = 15

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 15) which add up to -8 ... and those factors are -5 and -3

Therefore replace -8x with -5x - 3x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}-8 x+15&=0 \\ x^{2}-5 x-3 x+15&=0 \\ (x^{2}-5 x)-(3 x-15)&=0 \\ x(x-5)-3(x-5)&=0\\ (x-3)(x-5)&=0 \\ x-3=0 && \text{or} \quad x-5=0 \\ x=3 && x=5\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+3 x+2=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 3 and c = 2

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 2) which add up to 3 ... and those factors are 2 and 1

Therefore replace 3x with 2x + 1x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+3 x+2&=0 \\ x^{2}+2 x+1x+2&=0 \\ (x^{2}+2 x)+(1x+2)&=0 \\ x(x+2)+1(x+2)&=0 \\ (x+1)(x+2)&=0 \\ x+1=0 && \text{or} \quad x+2=0 \\ x=-1 && x=-2\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}-5 x+4=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = -5 and c = 4

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 4) which add up to -5 ... and those factors are -4 and -1

Therefore replace -5x with -4x - 1x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}-5 x+4&=0 \\ x^{2}-4 x-1 x+4&=0 \\ (x^{2}-4 x)-(1 x-4)&=0 \\ x(x-4)-1(x-4)&=0 \\ (x-1)(x-4)&=0 \\ x-1=0 && \text{or} \quad x-4=0 \\ x=1 && x=4\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+7 x+12=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 7 and c = 12

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 12) which add up to 7 ... and those factors are 4 and 3

Therefore replace 7x with 4x + 3x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+7 x+12&=0 \\ x^{2}+4 x+3 x+12&=0 \\ (x^{2}+4 x)+(3 x+12)&=0 \\ x(x+4)+3(x+4)&=0 \\ (x+3)(x+4)&=0 \\ x+3=0 && \text{or} \quad x+4=0 \\ x=-3 && x=-4\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+8 x+15=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 8 and c = 15

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 15) which add up to 8 ... and those factors are 5 and 3

Therefore replace 8x with 5x + 3x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+8 x+15&=0 \\ x^{2}+5 x+3 x+15&=0 \\ (x^{2}+5 x)+(3 x+15)&=0 \\ x(x+5)+3(x+5)&=0 \\ (x+3)(x+5)&=0 \\ x+3=0 && \text{or} \quad x+5=0 \\ x=-3 && x=-5\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+5 x=6\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+5 x&=6 \\ x^{2}+5 x-6&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 5 and c = -6

Looking for integer factors of (1 × -6) which add up to 5 ... and those factors are 6 and -1

Therefore replace 5x with 6x - 1x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+5 x-6&=0\\ x^{2}+6 x-1x-6&=0 \\ (x^{2}+6 x)-(1x+6)&=0 \\ x(x+6)-1(x+6)&=0 \\ (x-1)(x+6)&=0 \\ x-1=0 && \text{or} \quad x+6=0 \\ x=1 && x=-6\\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = 6
Evaluate \( x^{2}+5 x \) if \(x=1 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=1^{2}+5(1) \\ &=1+5 \\ &=6 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( x^{2}+5 x \) if \(x=-6 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=(-6)^{2}+5(-6) \\ &=36-30 \\ &=6 \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}=4x-4\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} x^{2}&=4x-4\\ x^{2}-4x+4&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = -4 and c = 4

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 4) which add up to -4 ... and those factors are -2 and -2

Therefore replace -4x with -2x - 2x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}-4x+4&=0 \\ x^{2}-2x-2x+4&=0 \\ (x^{2}-2x)-(2x-4)&=0 \\ x(x-2)-2(x-2)&=0 \\ (x-2)(x-2)&=0\\ x-2&=0 \\ x&=2 \\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS= RHS
Evaluate \( x^{2} \) if \(x=2 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=2^{2} \\ &=4 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 4x-4 \) if \(x=2 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=4(2)-4 \\ &=8-4\\ &=4 \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}=6x\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} x^{2}&=6x\\ x^{2}-6x&=0 \\ x(x-6)&=0 \\ x=0 && \text{or} \quad x-6=0 \\ && x=6\\ \end{align*} \]
Check LHS= RHS
Evaluate \( x^{2} \) if \(x=0 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=0^{2} \\ &=0 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 6x \) if \(x=0 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=6(0)\\ &=0 \\ \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( x^{2} \) if \(x=6 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=6^{2} \\ &=36 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( 6x \) if \(x=6 \)
\[ \begin{align*} &=6(6)\\ &=36\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \((2 x+5)(x-2)+7=0\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} (2 x+5)(x-2)+7&=0 \\ 2 x^{2}-4 x+5 x-10+7&=0 \\ 2 x^{2}+x-3&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 2, b = 1 and c = -3

Looking for integer factors of (2 × -3) which add up to 1 ... and those factors are 3 and -2

Therefore replace -6x with 3x - 2x \[ \begin{align*} 2 x^{2}+x-3&=0 \\ 2 x^{2}+3 x-2 x-3&=0 \\ (2 x^{2}+3 x)-(2 x+3)&=0 \\ x(2 x+3)-1(2 x+3)&=0 \\ (x-1)(2 x+3)&=0 \\ x-1=0 && \text{or} \quad 2 x+3=0 \\ x=1 && 2x = -3\\ && \dfrac{2 x}{2}=\dfrac{-3}{2} \\ && =-\dfrac{3}{2}\\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = 0
Evaluate \( (2 x+5)(x-2)+7=0\) if \(x=1\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=(2(1)+5)(1-2)+7 \\ &=(7)(-1)+7 \\ &=-7+7\\ &=0 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( (2 x+5)(x-2)+7=0\) if \(x=-\dfrac{3}{2}\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=\left(2\left(-\dfrac{3}{2}\right)+5\right)\left(\dfrac{-3}{2}-2\right)+7 \\ &=(-3 + 5)\left(\dfrac{-7}{2}\right)+7 \\ &=(2)\left(\dfrac{-7}{2}\right)+7 \\ &=-7+7\\ &=0 \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x+4=\dfrac{21}{x}\)
questions.answer:
\[ \begin{align*} x+4&=\dfrac{21}{x} \\ x^{2}+4 x&=21 \\ x^{2}+4 x-21&=0 \\ \end{align*} \]

Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 4 and c = -21

Looking for integer factors of (1 × -21) which add up to 4 ... and those factors are 7 and -3

Therefore replace 4x with 7x - 3x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+4 x-21&=0 \\ x^{2}+7 x-3 x-21&=0 \\ (x^{2}+7 x)-(3 x+21)&=0 \\ x(x+7)-3(x+7)&=0 \\ (x-3)(x+7)&=0 \\ x-3=0 && \text{or} \quad x+7=0 \\ x=3 && x=-7 \\ \end{align*} \]

Check LHS = RHS
Evaluate \( x+4\) if \(x=3\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=3+4 \\ &=7\\ \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( \dfrac{21}{x}\) if \(x=3\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=\dfrac{21}{3}\\ &=7\\ \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( x+4\) if \(x=-7\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=-7+4\\ &=-3 \end{align*} \]
Evaluate \( \dfrac{21}{x}\) if \(x=-7\)
\[ \begin{align*} &=\dfrac{21}{-7}\\ &=-3\\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}+6x+5=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = 6 and c = 5

Looking for integer factors of (1 × 5) which add up to 6 ... and those factors are 5 and 1

Therefore replace 6x with 5x + 1x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}+6x+5&=0 \\ x^{2}+5x+x+5&=0 \\ (x^{2}+5x)+(x+5)&=0 \\ x(x+5)+1(x+5)&=0 \\ (x+1)(x+5)&=0 \\ x+1=0 && \text{or} \quad x+5=0 \\ x=-1 && x=-5 \\ \end{align*} \]

questions.question: \(x^{2}-5x-6=0\)
questions.answer:
Compared to general form of quadratic equation, a = 1, b = -5 and c = -6

Looking for integer factors of (1 × -6) which add up to -5 ... and those factors are -6 and 1

Therefore replace -5x with -6x + 1x \[ \begin{align*} x^{2}-5x-6&=0 \\ (x^{2}-6x)+(x-6)&=0 \\ x^{2}-6x+x-6&=0 \\ x(x-6)+1(x-6)&=0 \\ (x+1)(x-6)&=0 \\ x+1=0 && \text{or} \quad x-6=0 \\ x=-1 && x=6 \\ \end{align*} \]
